instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (2018) EFI password unlock.
threads.message: Recently I got this machine for EFI unlock. It has T2 chip onboard. So I read about EFI unlock for these devices and got a bit confused. There is misinformation in this topic. Some people think, that it’s possible to read T2 ROM chip and remove EFI password like on machines without T2. Some think, that’s it’s impossible. So how it is? I was successful to read T2 ROM chip, but there is nothing similar to previos generation boards EFI. What is your experience in this field? All these unlocking programmers are just scam?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (2018) EFI password unlock.
threads.message:
CheckM8 just does a bypass.
It must be done each time after new macOS installation.
SoC ROM (<CHIP>U4770</CHIP>) is not the BIOS, which is saved into T2.

T203 pendrive sold by chinese is supposed to save the money needs to pay every time for CheckM8 online bypass.
We don't have a real feedback about how good it is...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (2018) EFI password unlock.
threads.message: [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER], thank you for info. I’m not going to get involved into such solutions for now, computer gets back to the customer. From one side it’s pity, that Apple has moved BIOS into T2, but from another side - previous “security” of EFI was funny… any person with cheapest programmer could remove password.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (2018) EFI password unlock.
threads.message:
in all the videos is to see after bypassig installing osx catalina.
is it possible to install ventura? and after every update its needfull to bypass agein, yes?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (2018) EFI password unlock.
threads.message: Actually, check8m works even with Ventura.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (2018) EFI password unlock.
threads.message: thanks, but is it realy needfull to bypass again and again?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (2018) EFI password unlock.
threads.message:
I think check8m service is paid once and you can use it more times in the same machine.
Check their website...
